description: Retrieves complete information about one canary. You must specify the name of the canary that you want. To get a list of canaries and their names, use DescribeCanaries.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the canary that you want details for.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique ID of this canary.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the canary.

nested_items.name: SourceLocationArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda layer where Synthetics stores the canary script code.

nested_items.name: Handler
nested_items.description: The entry point to use for the source code when running the canary.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role used to run the canary. This role must include lambda.amazonaws.com as a principal in the trust policy.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: A rate expression or a cron expression that defines how often the canary is to run.

nested_items.name: DurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: How long, in seconds, for the canary to continue making regular runs after it was created. The runs are performed according to the schedule in the Expression value.

nested_items.name: RetryConfig
nested_items.description: A structure that contains the retry configuration for a canary.

nested_items.name: MaxRetries
nested_items.description: The maximum number of retries. The value must be less than or equal to 2.

nested_items.name: RunConfig
nested_items.description: A structure that contains information about a canary run.

nested_items.name: TimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: How long the canary is allowed to run before it must stop.

nested_items.name: MemoryInMB
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory available to the canary while it is running, in MB. This value must be a multiple of 64.

nested_items.name: ActiveTracing
nested_items.description: Displays whether this canary run used active X-Ray tracing.

nested_items.name: EphemeralStorage
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of ephemeral storage (in MB) to allocate for the canary run during execution. This temporary storage is used for storing canary run artifacts (which are uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket at the end of the run), and any canary browser operations. This temporary storage is cleared after the run is completed. Default storage value is 1024 MB.

nested_items.name: SuccessRetentionPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: The number of days to retain data about successful runs of this canary.

nested_items.name: FailureRetentionPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: The number of days to retain data about failed runs of this canary.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the canary.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: If the canary creation or update failed, this field provides details on the failure.

nested_items.name: StateReasonCode
nested_items.description: If the canary creation or update failed, this field displays the reason code.

nested_items.name: Created
nested_items.description: The date and time the canary was created.

nested_items.name: LastModified
nested_items.description: The date and time the canary was most recently modified.

nested_items.name: LastStarted
nested_items.description: The date and time that the canary's most recent run started.

nested_items.name: LastStopped
nested_items.description: The date and time that the canary's most recent run ended.

nested_items.name: ArtifactS3Location
nested_items.description: The location in Amazon S3 where Synthetics stores artifacts from the runs of this canary. Artifacts include the log file, screenshots, and HAR files.

nested_items.name: EngineArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function that is used as your canary's engine. For more information about Lambda ARN format, see Resources and Conditions for Lambda Actions.

nested_items.name: RuntimeVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies the runtime version to use for the canary. For more information about runtime versions, see Canary Runtime Versions.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: If this canary is to test an endpoint in a VPC, this structure contains information about the subnets and security groups of the VPC endpoint. For more information, see Running a Canary in a VPC.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The IDs of the VPC where this canary is to run.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the subnets where this canary is to run.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the security groups for this canary.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Ipv6AllowedForDualStack
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this canary allows outbound IPv6 traffic if it is connected to dual-stack subnets.

nested_items.name: VisualReference
nested_items.description: If this canary performs visual monitoring by comparing screenshots, this structure contains the ID of the canary run to use as the baseline for screenshots, and the coordinates of any parts of the screen to ignore during the visual monitoring comparison.

nested_items.name: BaseScreenshots
nested_items.description: An array of screenshots that are used as the baseline for comparisons during visual monitoring.

nested_items.name: ScreenshotName
nested_items.description: The name of the screenshot. This is generated the first time the canary is run after the UpdateCanary operation that specified for this canary to perform visual monitoring.

nested_items.name: IgnoreCoordinates
nested_items.description: Coordinates that define the part of a screen to ignore during screenshot comparisons. To obtain the coordinates to use here, use the CloudWatch console to draw the boundaries on the screen. For more information, see Editing or deleting a canary.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BaseCanaryRunId
nested_items.description: The ID of the canary run that produced the baseline screenshots that are used for visual monitoring comparisons by this canary.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedResourceCleanup
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to also delete the Lambda functions and layers used by this canary when the canary is deleted. If it is AUTOMATIC, the Lambda functions and layers will be deleted when the canary is deleted.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ArtifactConfig
nested_items.description: A structure that contains the configuration for canary artifacts, including the encryption-at-rest settings for artifacts that the canary uploads to Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: S3Encryption
nested_items.description: A structure that contains the configuration of encryption settings for canary artifacts that are stored in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: EncryptionMode
nested_items.description: The encryption method to use for artifacts created by this canary. Specify SSE_S3 to use server-side encryption (SSE) with an Amazon S3-managed key. Specify SSE-KMS to use server-side encryption with a customer-managed KMS key.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the customer-managed KMS key to use, if you specify SSE-KMS for EncryptionMode.

nested_items.name: DryRunConfig
nested_items.description: Returns the dry run configurations for a canary.

nested_items.name: DryRunId
nested_items.description: The DryRunId associated with an existing canary's dry run. You can use this DryRunId to retrieve information about the dry run.

nested_items.name: LastDryRunExecutionStatus
nested_items.description: Returns the last execution status for a canary's dry run.
